name: Poly Bridge
description: Unleash your engineering creativity with an engaging and fresh bridge-building simulator with all the bells and whistles. Enjoy hours of physics-based puzzle solving in the Campaign and then jump in the Sandbox to create your own bridge designs and puzzles!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: 1GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 512Mb DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 150 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Don't let the cartoony and happy time polygons fool you; This is a game about life, and death.  The soothing guitar music is the bringer of the apocalypse.

10/10 Best bridge simulator 2015. Would destroy another bridge again and still succeed.  EDIT: An actual Review (As of 7/14/15)  Poly Bridge is one of the best Bridge-building simulators (idk if it's a simulator or not) I've ever played so far. I bought this game in early access and although there's some bugs and whatnot, it's playable from start to finish. The graphics and art style are simple, yet nice. I am a fan of the music. It's so relaxing that I literally slept because of this. The levels, although easy at first, are quite challenging and requires your brain to think further. Pretty much you can build anything! From regular bridges, to ramp jumps or even overly complicated tilting bridges or something like that. Still not fun w/ the existing levels? Try the workshop where over thousands of player-made levels. And finally, the developers of this game are quite responsive to the community fanbase which overall improved the experience of playing this game.  Overall I still gave this game 10/10. Would recommend to friends, family, construction workers, architects, civil engineers, anyone i can think of.

10/10    Before buying this game I was hesitant to the fact that it was a bridge building game. But it turns out that this is a really fun and esciting game. It provides a fun challenge through building pridges, solving puzzles, and overcoming obstacles. A must-buy!    Pros

Poly Bridge is a great and most in depth bridge builders around. It has the most versatile ways in building bridges and scenarios for the workshop. There is a ton of user created content for more fun than just whats in the base game. But with that comes a certain type of thinking. When building bridges you have to think outside the box, in plainer terms, you have to think of a better way of making bridges then just the basic straight line with supports. You can use ropes and metal bars to make the strongest bridge.    In short, Poly Bridge is a great and indepth bridge builder then some of the other ones out there. You have much more control over the bridges you're building and the strongest parts of it to make it take whatever truck your thinking to drive across.  Verdict:  95/100

This is a delightful little bridge builder with a nice art style, nice music, and no egregious bugs. The first 30 levels are solid and make you think.  Then the game turns into a MAKE THIS SWEET JUMP BRO DO A BARREL ROLL BRO CHECK OUT THIS FLIP ISN'T THIS GREAT simulator. Half of the levels past the first two lands are stunt jump levels, a quarter are hydraulics-abuse levels to make variable stunt jumps, and the rest are tedious fox/goose/beans puzzles using hydraulics abuse. There's maybe 5 or 6 levels that involve actually building bridges past the second world. So, 100+ levels? I guess so. Technically. In practicality there's under 40.  I had fun with this game. It has great potential. I just can't recommend it, not when an overwhelming majority of the levels aren't actually about building bridges.

Poly Bridge is a lot like an engineering class. You start the game and some random old guy starts showing some super basic things. Like ok I get triangles, are my friends. Then he goes on to work through a few examples which seem pretty trivial. Then you move on to trying to do some of the book problems by yourself (ex: Alpine Meadow). It's a bit of a challenge, but after a few cups of coffee you figure it out. By that point you're thinking to yourself 'I'm going to be a freaking God at this'. And then comes the final exam where they ask you to create an elevator catapult which has to withstand the stress of an incoming boat. And just for ♥♥♥♥♥ and giggles, you also have to design a few Evil Knievel jumps which seem completely impractical and a public safety menace.   Basically, if you like physic based puzzles this game is for you. It may give you PTSD like my Fluid Dynamics class did to me back in the day, but in the end you get the satisfaction of having worked out the problem (or looked online for the answer, whichever I ain't judging). Oh and yes 'triangles are your friend'...

This is such a great game, and the initial turorial is short and straight forward enough to have you building bridges in no time. Really simple to play, but also deep enough to experiment with more advanced bridge designs. It's so satifying to see your creation work out well when you test it out, and you can't help but go back and tweak the design to shave a few more bucks off the overall budget of the build. There's different worlds to advance through, split into many levels. Leaderboards add a great bit of competition, and also spur you to go back and refine your designs. The graphics are really easy on the eye, and the music is great and relaxing too! And lastly, the controls are spread over the keyboard and mouse, so you can use just the mouse for everything, or a combination of both together.
A nice light game, away from ever popular AAA games.

I love puzzle games and games that make you think. This is definitely one of those games. When I get to a level that frustrates me I turn the game off and mull over it and think about ways I could make it work and I come back to try new things with a fresh outlook on it and it makes it all the more rewarding when I finally get past that difficult level. I highly recommend this game!
